column4: right click on the wmv file, go to properties, and do the "open with" and type new command, "vlc."
I can't click on it, because its on the web
I can only click play and then it tries to open with totem
there is no open with option :(
try changing the mime type in the firefox options to open with vlc
how would i go about doing that?
Tools -> Preferences -> Content -> File Types
ok i'm there now how do i add an extention relationship?
you cant "make" one there, only edit. I assumed you had wmv there since it is indeed playing them.
hmm darn....
sudo apt-get install vlc vlc-plugin-esd mozilla-plugin-vlc libdvdcss2 from http://www.videolan.org/vlc/download-ubuntu.html
sudo apt-get install vlc vlc-plugin-esd mozilla-plugin-vlc libdvdcss2
do you have the universe repository enabled?
the what??\\
: sudo apt-get install vlc vlc-plugin-esd mozilla-plugin-vlc libdvdcss2
go to the System -> Administration -> Software Sources menu from your Gnome desktop. Checkmark "Community-maintained Open Source software (universe)."
already was checked
ok, then run "sudo apt-get install vlc vlc-plugin-esd mozilla-plugin-vlc" in terminal
ok its done
now what?
close firefox, try to play a WMV video again in firefox
